title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 441.3 - [Effective 7/11/2025] Applicability, Effective Dates and Notice
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 441.3 - [Effective 7/11/2025] Applicability, Effective Dates and Notice

State Regulations

The Formulary shall apply to all prescriptions following an
accident or injury regardless of the date of accident or disablement and
regardless of where the claimant lives. The Formulary shall be subject to the
following: (a) Effective Dates. (1)

New Prescriptions. Six months from the
effective date of this Part, every new prescription shall be prescribed and
dispensed consistent with the Formulary and this Part regardless of the date of
accident or disablement and subject to any required Prior

Authorization. (2)

Refill and

Renewal Prescriptions. On or after September 13, 2021, every refill and renewal
prescription shall be prescribed and dispensed consistent with the Formulary
and this Part regardless of the date of accident or disablement and subject to
any required Prior Authorization. (b) The Formulary shall apply to
prescriptions for accidents or injuries that are controverted or body parts or
conditions not yet accepted by the insurance carrier or self-insured
employer. (c) The Pharmacy Fee

Schedule set forth in Part 440 of this Subchapter remains in effect and
includes pricing for prescriptions including Compound Drugs, the rules
governing use of pharmacy networks and payments for prescriptions when the
claim is controverted. (d) The

Formulary shall not apply to drugs when such drugs are administered in a
hospital or medical provider's office. (e) The Formulary shall apply to drugs that
are dispensed by a medical provider acting within the scope of his or her
practice and pursuant to the dispensing limitations set forth in section
6807
(2)
of the Education Law. (f) Notice. The insurance carrier or
self-insured employer shall identify all claimants with current prescriptions
for Non-Formulary drugs and provide written notification to the claimant and to
the prescribing medical provider. Notice to the prescribing medical provider
and to the claimant shall be in the format prescribed by the Chair. Notes

441.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
